content: So I am updating my review after a good year of stability, updates and usage. These are referred to as Wave Graphs. 2) I would love the option to just export the Wave Graph itself as a image as it serves far better than sending the letters a sound file they wont listen to. content: This used to be a great app -- lots of features and control with an intuitive interface.  But it seems the developer has net kept up with Android OS updates and (in contrast to the past) has become unresponsive to feedback.  Some things that no longer work: writing to a "public" area on an external SD card (the developer had a fix that worked on Android 5-7 but is broken on Android 9 (Pie), though many other apps, including recording apps, have been able to implement this successfully; and "disable AGC" (a setting that is important for high-quality music recording) results in disabling stereo recording.  Also the "disable AGC" option has never been available for "back microphone" and "default" Source options; I've written to the developer about this (and writing to SD card) but gotten no response.
replyContent:
Hi,

Thank you for this long feedback.
I worked on the external SDCard problem, but for many reasons, there is no easy solution (using the Android file management break a lot of features with ffmpeg).

For the stereo problem with AGC disabled, I have to look at it again. It works well with my testing devices (Oneplus 6T, S5, ...)

regards,

content: Needs to be able to record straight to the SD card. Everything else is great, but without this feature, it feels a bit lacking.
Perfect for what I want. Good quality recording at last

Fantastic sound quality with a simple visual interface that allows microphone adjustment and visual feedback during recording. Easy manipulation of pitch and speed make this a perfect tool for capturing and transcribing musical ideas.   One suggestion: Some people seem to be confused by having to touch the eject/arrow symbol to return to the recording interface. It seems that people think the recording button occasionally disappears due to a bug because they don't understand how to toggle between the file and record interfaces. Perhaps something as simple as making the toggle button red like the record button (or orange, or any color that would make it more visual) will help people understand that it is a toggle.

I'm looking forward to using this on the Google Pixel line and trying out all of the features to see what works. I'm most interested in the Tasker usage that I saw in the help file. If that works so that I can trigger AutoPebble to start recordings from my watch and it's decent recording quality with no skipping, then I'll bump a star up. The only other concern I have is there are many typos in English in the documentation and descriptions I have seen for the app - while I know that's not necessarily an indicator of functionality, it would definitely help newer users.

content: Needs an Android 7.0 update once you get the volume levels figured out!

I use it for capturing thoughts.  It's the closest app I've found to a true dictaphone. Good work. Love it.  Developers might like to consider adding an optional spectrum analyzer with a choice of the number of frequently bands.  They also may like to consider improving auto pause restart capabilities in places of high background noise(e.g. car, street, shower, quiet). But please, if you do, don't let it impact on the runtime performance and be sure to keep testing on the cheaper less powerful or older phones.    Awesome app. Keep on improving it. You've got a good product there. Hard to find these days. Good work!  Also, the recording in a quiet environment doesn't work so well on my Xperia when the phone is charging from mains. Too much background noise. Works fine on battery.  When in skipping silence mode, on scheduled recording, it would be great if it datetime stamped each auto start and stop point with easy to read text. **     I can't read the tiny text on the top of the graphical display.  When using auto-convert on closing, of large files, the writing metadata appears to either be getting into a continuous loop or is just taking way too long to complete.  Still a great app though. Please keep on working on it. **My EDIT: It does datetimestamp auto start-stop points, providing you leave the format alone (e.g. As .wav). I was auto converting the format upon stop recording whence the timestamp info gets lost unfortunately.

I had high hopes for this app and at first had loved it - the quality of the recordings was high and I was looking forward to using the ability to edit recordings and make clippings for memorization (gross anatomy and histology courses) BUT the interface is not easy to use and resulted in the following situational issue, making me hesitant to continue using it.  The app apparently saves recordings automatically to whichever folder you last browsed. So I made a folder within the app's directory for my class lectures. Recorded lectures for 2 weeks and was able to listen to them in the app, though had not yet had time to figure out how to save them to the cloud and back them up. Then a necessary phone update happened and everything got strange. The day before my final, all of a sudden none of my recordings were in the app. the folder I had made was completely gone. I searched my phone and originally it found the recordings burried elsewhere (of course with the finder not indicating where, though they were listed in the Samsung music player), so I go to listen to them and they won't play as mp4s (and the ones I had converted to mp3s and relabeled were gone from the start). So I downloaded vlc player to listen to them, crashed the program, reopened and when I went to look for them again via finder they were gone. After 2 hours of searching my phone and digging through it on my comp (the directory folder displayed it was last updated at 7:42 am that day, when I was driving to work and not in the app) and a call to AT&T tech support, no luck they were gone. My only guess is that the app's folder directory is technically a cache file that was slowly being cleared away in the background of my phone after the update. So in the end I lost my favorite study aid that had been working wonderfully previously the night before the test.   I'm switching to a recording app with an easier user interface and automatic uploads to the cloud.

I have tried to use it at least 20 times now!  Definitely gave it the old College try! This software (Pro Version) seems to be artificially limiting (by brute force clipping) the signal it records based on the gain settings. True audio gain is not processed like this. In this app, using a negative gain only creates a false ceiling. It basically clips your audio at a lower volume. What the heck?

Okay, this is super frustrating. I used the free version for a couple days and it worked brilliantly. Then it suddenly started crashing upon launching the app. figured it would be worth it to pay the 3 dollars to get the pro version. Hi,

You probably don't have the write permissions for the directory you chose in the options.

You can uninstall and reinstall RecForge  to remove the settings file.

content: Low playback volume.  I may have overlooked something in settings as I'm not particularly tech savvy.  I love this app, it's easy to use, conversion is a breeze, but when I email mp3s or just listen to the playback, I can get much volume.  Anyone have an idea what i might be doing wrong?
replyContent:
Hi,

You can either enable the AGC setting (Automatic Gain Control) or increase the gain level (slide above the control panel of the main screen).

1 / https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/58769997/RecForgeII/html/faq.html#disableagc

2 / https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/58769997/RecForgeII/html/faq.html#adjustgain

Best regards,

content: FOREWORD: I NEVER EVER WRITE APP REVIEWS, SO BY THE SHEER FACT I HAVE FELT COMPELLED TO DO SO FOR THIS ONE SHOULD MAKE YOU WANT TO READ FURTHER!!!!!!!.                                All other recording apps on Google Play should drop to their worthless knees and gleefully lick the boots of 'Rec Forges' developer. This does everything it says on the tin, and with the purchase of the amazingly cheap Pro version it does a whole lot more, and what I also like about this app is that there are regular updates/improvements which makes a refreshing change, as I will not waste money on other apps that have NOT been updated for over 6 months to a year as this indicates that the developer of those Apps are lazy slack fishes & they clearly have contempt for their paying customers!!!.                               This was without a shadow of a doubt my best purchase of 2015 so far, and being honest with you all I cannot see any other recording app on Google Play coming close to eclipsing this top  notch quality app anytime soon. I salute all persons concerned in the production of this App. Cheers Ears!!!!.
replyContent:
Thank you very much.
It's nice to read this kind of review :)

content: If you care about sound quality, you're probably going to want to record in flac (lossless but large files) or opus/ogg (lossy, but good quality and smaller file sizes). This app will let you capture audio in the best possible quality that your device allows, though sometimes settings can need a little tweaking, it's highly worth it!   It also works great with an external mic. I connected this up to my Blue Yeti microphone with an OTG cable and the sound is as excellent as you'd expect. Highly recommended!
replyContent: Thank you very much :)

content: One of the harder to find but definitely the best recording app I have used to date. It does one thing: it records. But it does so in a simple configurable way, so you can setup you recording however you need once and then just record however many times you want.
replyContent: Thank you :)

content: You would think buying the full version would include all the features,  but it does not.  You can only record for 3 minutes with the full version. You have to spend another $5 to remove that limitation.

content: OK  compliment sandwich. First I would like to say I love the versatility of this app. The fact that I can use it for audio tracks on videos is often. The only problems I see is that I can't seem to find out how to record with the tone and pitch modifiers running too. Also having difficulty getting the concatenate function to run smoothly. And an instructional tutorial would be nice. Or maybe a downloadable manual? Bit I love the fact that I can merge more than four tracks together.
Everytime i change the pitch and save it to mp3 the original pitch plays instead of the modified one please help me!!!

could u please make a shortcut for switching between recording modes: either RecForge should remember the last settings used for wav and another lossy format when switching between them - or switching presets could do it too :)
Please Cancel the lock screen notification

I upgrade from RecForge II because I find this app very useful in terms of the sound quality recorded. I use this app with R√òDE smartLav+ lavalier microphone to record interviews in all my videoshoots. Highly recommended!!
damn it
I paid 4 the app and can't figure it out. How to import

There's something wrong with the file browser UI. It has very slow rendering, slower than any other app I've used on my phone (Galaxy Note 4). Often you can see the frame flicker and redraw. Lags when tapping to select a file. Scrolling is laggy. It's also difficult to listen to the recordings because you cannot flip back and forth between them like other programs can. You have to manually press stop on each recording before you are allowed to play another one. No other playlists are like that. Bad design.

I used recforge lite for ages because that really does everything you need for free. Decided to buy it because I use it all the time. All the features you want for quality, file types, time stretching, etc are there. Uncluttered interface, good widgets. Without this some of our spontaneous lunchtime jams at work would be lost forever! Rock on! Thanks!
Should let me access and work to/from my external SD, though.
Sometimes the controls do unexpected things, like not record. I'm not sure what's up, but it maybe the UX is too involved for me. What I like & need is the Tasker integration.

This is a top app, records beautiful quality with an external microphone (iRig Mic Cast) - Which thanks to this app captures crisp and clear audio which sounds professional. I highly recommend people keep clear of standard recorders/editors, they produce poor quality and for the price of this its great value! To think of the iRig Recorders price, this is a steal and IT WORKS. Try it before you buy and save money from buggy alternatives which costs twice to three times what thus does. Great app! I love it.

Works great with Samsung Note 4. Select native stereo and rear mic, and the program will use both mics, allowing the user to make true stereo recordings. Also turn AGC  off and use the record volume slider.

I use this with a Rode smartLav+ with great results. It's the only app that I've found that allows negative gain, WAV, and real-time monitoring of waveform. The only thing I don't like is that the recording button doesn't look like a recording button. Suggest changing the icon to round and making it red.
I had been looking for a recorder with schedule, this is great. Unfortunately, it so ugly and kind of confusing when using

It's great for recording, although it doesn't have as much editing tools as I would have liked. It's great for capturing the talent but that's roughly it. This app is best used as a field recorder or mobile on the spot recorder.

Audio sounds amazing. Other apps screw up the audio and muffle it. I have a cheap Rode smartLav+ on here...sounds amazing. Really impressed! Definitely work it. Easy interface to get used to (like in 45 seconds). Works when you leave the app too. Question: how to make it not be in notifications?
makes short work of taking old cassette recordings & digitizing them.

Needs more stuff like when you merge song make it were you can change the pitch of every song please, or can you add a feature that puts the song in g major please? That would make this app better then any other out there, please add those or one of those please?
Purchased for echo effect. But no echo effect present in app for me :-(
